# Section 1

## LaTeX Table

```{=latex}
\begin{table}[h]
\centering
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|}
\hline
A & B \\
\hline
1 & 2 \\
3 & 4 \\
\hline
\end{tabular}
\caption{LaTeX Table}
\label{table:latex}
\end{table}


With this setup, LaTeX-style references are used for the LaTeX table, and manual references are used for the Markdown table.
xxxxxxv
In this example, you can refer to the LaTeX table with "Refer to Table \ref{table:latex}" and to the Markdown table manually as "Refer to Table 2".



| C | D |
|---|---|
| 5 | 6 |
| 7 | 8 |

Table: Markdown Table. This is the Markdown table caption.
label:Markdown
